Description: Handle-plate of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery column-krater; on top of handle plate, black lotus and palmette cross; on front of plate, frieze of ivy leaves; glazed black on sides of plate; on underside, traces of black at handle roots.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0161) (Phase 1)
